intro: Paepalanthus fraternus, commonly known as the dwarf puya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces striking, colorful inflorescences that resemble candles, which are typically composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
